reviewText: I'm old, but this is ok.  I will watch this again over time, but I prefer all concert footage on one DVD and the rest on the other.  RIP Mr. Abbott.  Very random Pantera.  They should have given Darrell more footage, but I'd still have a few drinks with them, if they could keep up:)

reviewText: I love the re-released version of this dvd.  I borrowed a friends and he had the old 1999 release one disc version.  It didn't feature chapters or anything.  This release is amazing, you can actually choose weather you just wanna watch the music videos, I love that option.  This is well worth the money if your a big pantera fan, or just getting to know who they are.

Title: N/A

reviewText: As a native of Dallas, and a Pantera fan, I enjoy seeing the club footage shot in "The Basement".  Pantera are relentless in this footage of life on the road.  I enjoyed the live music footage the most, and though I rate the DVD highly, I wish it had an option to only view the music, and not all the antics everytime, though they are fun to watch the first time through. I would say any Pantera fan would be pleased to own this in their collection!
summary: Cowboys from Hell that don't let up!

reviewText: The Best DVD I OWN!!! oh yeh.. it is a great DVD for metal fans to have.. and even if u dont like pantera.. it is hilarious..The music videos are great.. the ones that r on it are...Cowboys From Hell, Cemetary Gates, Psycho Holiday, Walk, Mouth For War, This Love, 5 Minutes Alone, I'm Broken, Planet Caravan, and Drag The Waters..All great videos.. My fave video is.. probably 5 Minutes Alone.. cuz u get 2 see Phil whoop a crash dummy's ass before it.. OH YEH! lolz..

Title: N/A

reviewText: First off let me tell you that Pantera even after long gone now, still kicks major ass, and this DVD proves it. The 3 VHS home videos in one, WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK FOR? Well ok, you could ask for a little chapter division so you can skip to wherever part of the videos youd like to see but hey, if this is the only way to appreciate this tremendous band in their heyday, f** it! just enjoy it , man. But if you are the kind of mofo who likes to bug about every little detail then f*** off @sshole! Pantera rules! and Dimebag lives on! The best behind the scenes look Ive seen in a long time, every time I check this DVD out I cant help but feel overjoyed and sad at the same time. Overjoyed for all the hillarious footage and sad for the death of one of power metal's best guitarists. R.I.P. DIMEBAG. Gone but not forgotten.
summary: WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK FOR?

reviewText: This is the best Home Video/DVD I've ever seen.  It has all their videos (and they look fantastic on DVD), rare live performances (like the duet with Skid Row), and it's hilarious!  Even if your not a Pantera fan, you'll find yourself laughing out loud at the antics they pull.
summary: THE COWBOYS FROM HELL ARE FUNNY AS HELL
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD compilation of all of Pantera's "home videos" is a great insight into the band itself. Now be forewarned, this is not the videos you want to show the kids (unless you want them to grow up and be rock stars) and simple minded adults beware as well. It will truly offend your delicate sensibilities. Nudity, swearing and the use of a certain plant that some folks roll up and smoke abounds in this production. None of this bothered me. I was unaware of just exactly what goes on in the life of a big time rock and roll star. This release leaves nothing, and I mean NOTHING, to the imagination. It displays many of their fan based philosophies. Phil Anselmo goes to bat for a single fan that is being jacked around by security. Most bands don't really care if half the audience gets ejected as long as they have paid for the ticket. The fan interactions are what makes Pantera a band for the fans. This is a band that loves their fans and wants everyone to leave their show just blown away. Which they usualy do. Pick this DVD up and feel the intensity that is Pantera. Special guest apperiances include Skid Row, Alice in Chains, Kerry King of Slayer, Rob Halford of Judas Priest fame plus many others. There is also some footage of one of their guys who sat on a copy machine and went through the glass. What is shocking about that you might ask, well the guys pants and underwear were down. He was going to xerox his rearend and wound up with multiple lacerations on his checks and and legs. Nothing serious though, just minor cuts and scrapes. Now another member of their crew has a gigantic boil on butt check and it shows the doctor lance it and squeeze the contents out. Truly classic material. Just check it out.
summary: Awesome DVD about an awesome band

reviewText: Just about everything you could want in a bad a$$ no BS Heavy DVD from the most bad a$$ Heavy band that ever was... And yes, couldn't have said it better, totally awesome for watching while preloading for a night out!! PANTERA's off stage antics make the clowns from cKy look like the wiggles... To this day it's still hard to believe Dime's gone, Him and Vinnie were huge inspirations to me as a musician and even as a person (well, at least with my partyin' habits, HAHA!) You will be forever missed...RIP Dime!
